text: You have recently started a new job at a retailer as an engineer. As part of this new role, you have been tasked with evaluating multiple outages that occurred during peak shopping time during the holiday season. Your investigation found that the team is manually deploying new compute instances and configuring each compute instance manually. This has led to inconsistent configuration between each compute instance. How would you solve this using infrastructure as code?
options: Implement a ticketing workflow that makes engineers submit a ticket before manually provisioning and configuring a resource
Implement a checklist that engineers can follow when configuring compute instances
Replace the compute instance type with a larger version to reduce the number of required deployments
Implement a provisioning pipeline that deploys infrastructure configurations committed to your version control system following code reviews

text: Most Terraform providers interact with ____________.
options: None of the answers are correct

text: You created infrastructure outside of the Terraform workflow that you now want to manage using Terraform. Which command brings the infrastructure into Terraform state?
Which of these are secure options for storing secrets for connecting to a Terraform remote backend? (Choose two.)
options: Inside the backend block within the Terraform configuration
Defined in a connection configuration outside of Terraform

text: A provider configuration block is required in every Terraform configuration.
You can configure Terraform to log to a file using the TF_LOG environment variable.

Your DevOps team is currently using the local backend for your Terraform configuration. You would like to move to a remote backend to begin storing the state file in a central location. Which of the following backends would not work?
Terraform validate reports syntax check errors from which of the following scenarios?
options: Code contains tabs indentation instead of spaces
There is missing value for a variable
The state files does not match the current infrastructure
None of the answers are correct

text: Which of the following is not a valid Terraform variable type?
How can a ticket-based system slow down infrastructure provisioning and limit the ability to scale? (Choose two.)
options: End-users have to request infrastructure changes
Ticket based systems generate a full audit trail of the request and fulfillment process
Users can access a catalog of approved resources from drop down lists in a request form
The more resources your organization needs, the more tickets your infrastructure team has to process

text: How can a ticket-based system slow down infrastructure provisioning and limit the ability to scale? (Choose two.)
options: A full audit trail of the request and fulfillment process is generated
A request must be submitted for infrastructure changes
As additional resources are required, more tickets are submitted
A catalog of approved resources can be accessed from drop down lists in a request form

text: You have declared a variable called var.list which is a list of objects that all have an attribute id. Which options will produce a list of the IDs? (Choose two.)
options: { for o in var.list : o => o.id }

text: Terraform can only manage resource dependencies if you set them explicitly with the depends_on argument.
Setting the TF_LOG environment variable to DEBUG causes debug messages to be logged into stdout.
All standard backend types support state storage, locking, and remote operations like plan, apply and destroy.

You've used Terraform to deploy a virtual machine and a database. You want to replace this virtual machine instance with an identical one without affecting the database. What is the best way to achieve this using Terraform?
options: Use the terraform state rm command to remove the VM from state file
Use the terraform taint command targeting the VMs then run terraform plan and terraform apply
Use the terraform apply command targeting the VM resources only
Delete the Terraform VM resources from your Terraform code then run terraform plan and terraform apply

text: Which provisioner invokes a process on the resource created by Terraform?
How would you reference the Volume IDs associated with the ebs_block_device blocks in this configuration?
One cloud configuration always maps to a single remote workspace.
Why would you use the -replace flag for terraform apply?
options: You want to force Terraform to destroy a resource on the next apply
You want Terraform to ignore a resource on the next apply
You want to force Terraform to destroy and recreate a resource on the next apply
You want Terraform to destroy all the infrastructure in your workspace

text: Which of the following statements about local modules is incorrect?
options: Local modules are not cached by terraform init command
Local modules are sourced from a directory on disk
None of the answers are correct

text: What is the name assigned by Terraform to reference this resource?
What is the name assigned by Terraform to reference this resource?
In a Terraform Cloud workspace linked to a version control repository, speculative plan runs start automatically when you merge or commit changes to version control.
One remote backend configuration always maps to a single remote workspace.
When running the command terraform taint against a managed resource you want to force recreation upon, Terraform will immediately destroy and recreate the resource.
What does this code do?
options: Requires any version of the AWS provider >= 3.0 and < 4.0
Requires any version of the AWS provider >= 3.0
Requires any version of the AWS provider after the 3.0 major release, like 4.1
Requires any version of the AWS provider > 3.0

text: Where can Terraform not load a provider from?
____________ backends support state locking.
Which of the following commands would you use to access all of the attributes and details of a resource managed by Terraform?
Which of the following commands would you use to access all of the attributes and details of a resource managed by Terraform?
When using Terraform to deploy resources into Azure, which scenarios are true regarding state files? (Choose two.)
options: When you change a Terraform-managed resource via the Azure Cloud Console, Terraform updates the state file to reflect the change during the next plan or apply
Changing resources via the Azure Cloud Console records the change in the current state file
When you change a resource via the Azure Cloud Console, Terraform records the changes in a new state file
Changing resources via the Azure Cloud Console does not update current state file

text: When using Terraform to deploy resources into Azure, which scenarios are true regarding state files? (Choose two.)
options: When a change is made to the resources via the Azure Cloud Console, the changes are recorded in a new state file
When a change is made to the resources via the Azure Cloud Console, Terraform will update the state file to reflect them during the next plan or apply
When a change is made to the resources via the Azure Cloud Console, the current state file will not be updated
When a change is made to the resources via the Azure Cloud Console, the changes are recorded in the current state file

text: Terraform provisioners that require authentication can use the ______ block.
You want to share Terraform state with your team, store it securely, and provide state locking. How would you do this? (Choose three.)
options: Using the remote Terraform backend with Terraform Cloud / Terraform Enterprise.
Using the s3 terraform backend. The dynamodb_field option is not needed.
Using an s3 terraform backend with an appropriate IAM policy and dynamodb_field option configured.

text: Running terraform fmt without any flags in a directory with Terraform configuration files will check the formatting of those files without changing their contents.
Which of these is not a benefit of remote state?
options: Keeping unencrypted sensitive information off disk

text: If a DevOps team adopts AWS CloudFormation as their standardized method for provisioning public cloud resources, which of the following scenarios poses a challenge for this team?
options: The team is asked to build a reusable code base that can deploy resources into any AWS region
The team is asked to manage a new application stack built on AWS-native services
The organization decides to expand into Azure and wishes to deploy new infrastructure using their existing codebase
The DevOps team is tasked with automating a manual provisioning process

text: Which of the following can you do with terraform plan? (Choose two.)
options: Save a generated execution plan to apply later
Execute a plan in a different workspace
View the execution plan and check if the changes match your expectations
Schedule Terraform to run at a planned time in the future

text: In contrast to Terraform Open Source, when working with Terraform Enterprise and Cloud Workspaces, conceptually you could think about them as completely separate working directories.
Terraform provisioners can be added to any resource block.
You have to initialize a Terraform backend before it can be configured.
Which of the following is not considered a safe way to inject sensitive values into a Terraform Cloud workspace?
options: Edit the state file directly just before running terraform apply
Set the variable value on the command line with the -var flag
Write the value to a file and specify the file with the -var-file flag

text: Which of the following is the safest way to inject sensitive values into a Terraform Cloud workspace?
options: Write the value to a file and specify the file with the -var-file flag
Set a value for the variable in the UI and check the "Sensitive" check box
Edit the state file directly just before running terraform apply
Set the variable value on the command line with the -var flag

text: You are using a networking module in your Terraform configuration with the name label my_network. In your main configuration you have the following code: When you run terraform validate, you get the following error: What must you do to successfully retrieve this value from your networking module?
options: Define the attribute vnet_id as a variable in the networking module
Change the referenced value to module.my_network.outputs.vnet_id
Define the attribute vnet_id as an output in the networking module
Change the referenced value to my_network.outputs.vnet_id

text: The .terraform.lock.hcl file tracks module versions.
Which of the following is not an advantage of using infrastructure as code operations?
options: Troubleshoot via a Linux diff command
Modify a count parameter to scale resources

text: Once a new Terraform backend is configured with a Terraform code block, which command(s) is (are) used to migrate the state file?
When do you need to explicitly execute terraform refresh?
options: None of the answers are correct

text: Which are examples of infrastructure as code? (Choose two.)
You must initialize your working directory before running terraform validate.
What functionality do providers offer in Terraform? (Choose three.)
options: Provision resources for on-premises infrastructure services.
Provision resources for public cloud infrastructure services.
Group a collection of Terraform configuration files that map to a single state file.

text: When should you use the force-unlock command?
options: You see a status message that you cannot acquire the lock
You have a high priority change
You apply failed due to a state lock

text: You are creating a Terraform configuration which needs to make use of multiple providers, one for AWS and one for Datadog. Which of the following provider blocks would allow you to do this?
Which of the following is not a benefit of adopting infrastructure as code?
Which of the following is not a benefit of adopting infrastructure as code?

You want to tag multiple resources with a string that is a combination of a generated random_id and a variable. How should you use the same value in all these resources without repeating the random_id and variable in each resource?
The ________ determines how Terraform creates, updates, or deletes resources.

You need to deploy resources into two different cloud regions in the same Terraform configuration. To do that, you declare multiple provider configurations. What meta-argument do you need to configure in a resource block to deploy the resource to the us-west-2 AWS region?
Which of these statements about Terraform Enterprise workspaces is false?
options: They can securely store cloud credentials
You must use the CLI to switch between workspaces
Plans and applies can be triggered via version control system integrations

text: What are some benefits of using Sentinel with Terraform Cloud/Terraform Enterprise? (Choose three.)
options: Policy-as-code can enforce security best practices
You can restrict specific configurations on resources like "CIDR=0.0.0.0/0" not allowed
You can enforce a list of approved AWS AMIs
Sentinel Policies can be written in HashiCorp Configuration Language (HCL)
You can check out and check in cloud access keys

text: Before you can use a new backend or HCP Terraform/Terraform Cloud integration, you must first execute terraform init.
What happens when you execute terraform plan?
options: Imports all of your existing cloud provider resources to the state.
Installs all providers and modules referenced by configuration.
Compares your Terraform code and local state file to the remote state file in a cloud provider and determines if any changes need to be made.
Refreshes your state, then compares your state file to your Terraform configuration and creates an execution plan if any changes need to be made.

text: In Terraform 0.13 and above, outside of the required_providers block, Terraform configurations always refer to providers by their local names.
Which option cannot be used to keep secrets out of Terraform configuration files?
The Terraform CLI will print output values from a child module after running terraform apply.
Which two steps are required to provision new infrastructure in the Terraform workflow? (Choose two.)
Select the command that doesn't cause Terraform to refresh its state.
You can develop a custom provider to manage its resources using Terraform.
If a Terraform creation-time provisioner fails, what will occur by default?
options: The resource will not be affected, but the provisioner will need to be applied again
The resource will be marked as "tainted"
Nothing, provisioners will not show errors in the command line

text: Which of the following is not true of Terraform providers?
options: An individual person can write a Terraform Provider
A community of users can maintain a provider
Cloud providers and infrastructure vendors can write, maintain, or collaborate on Terraform providers
None of the answers are correct

text: Which provisioner invokes a process on the machine running Terraform?
